messages.content: ComfyUI-TTS is a tool that allows you to convert strings within ComfyUI to audio so you can hear what's written.
What was the objective of creating ComfyUI-TTS?
The objective was to be able to use it with LLM AI models, but also leave the door open for many other uses.
Which TTS program was first chosen to be implemented in ComfyUI-TTS?
Piper-tts was the first TTS program chosen to be implemented because it's meant to be easy to do so.
What files are used by Piper-tts for its models?
Piper-tts uses ONNX models along with a JSON file which should be named the same as the onnx, but with a .json extension.
What is ComfyUI-Manager and how is it related to ComfyUI-TTS?
ComfyUI-Manager is a tool that lets us use Stable Diffusion using a flow graph layout. It is highly recommended for using ComfyUI-TTS.
What are the upcoming features planned for ComfyUI-TTS?
The upcoming features include expanding the Piper-tts function options and then starting work on implementing basic XTTSv2.
How can users install ComfyUI-TTS using Comfy Manager?
Users can install ComfyUI-TTS using Comfy Manager by visiting the Install Custom Nodes page, searching for ComfyUI-TTS, hitting Install and restarting when prompted.
Where should users copy the ONNX and JSON files for the models?
Users should copy the ONNX and JSON files into ./ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ComfyUI-TTS/models/*
